intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_EXCEPTION_MASK
intrinsic.description: Macro: Get the exception mask bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The exception mask may contain any of the following flags: _MM_MASK_INVALID, _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO, _MM_MASK_DENORM, _MM_MASK_OVERFLOW, _MM_MASK_UNDERFLOW, _MM_MASK_INEXACT
intrinsic.operation: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_MASK_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_EXCEPTION_MASK
intrinsic.description: Macro: Set the exception mask bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer "a". The exception mask may contain any of the following flags: _MM_MASK_INVALID, _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO, _MM_MASK_DENORM, _MM_MASK_OVERFLOW, _MM_MASK_UNDERFLOW, _MM_MASK_INEXACT
intrinsic.operation: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_MASK_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.description: Macro: Get the rounding mode bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The rounding mode may contain any of the following flags: _MM_ROUND_NEAREST, _MM_ROUND_DOWN, _MM_ROUND_UP, _MM_ROUND_TOWARD_ZERO
intrinsic.operation: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_ROUND_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_ROUNDING_MODE
intrinsic.description: Macro: Set the rounding mode bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer "a". The rounding mode may contain any of the following flags: _MM_ROUND_NEAREST, _MM_ROUND_DOWN, _MM_ROUND_UP, _MM_ROUND_TOWARD_ZERO
intrinsic.operation: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_ROUND_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_EXCEPTION_STATE
intrinsic.description: Macro: Set the exception state bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer "a". The exception state may contain any of the following flags: _MM_EXCEPT_INVALID, _MM_EXCEPT_DIV_ZERO, _MM_EXCEPT_DENORM, _MM_EXCEPT_OVERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_UNDERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_INEXACT
intrinsic.operation: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_EXCEPT_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_FLUSH_ZERO_MODE
intrinsic.description: Macro: Get the flush zero bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The flush zero may contain any of the following flags: _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_ON or _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_OFF
intrinsic.operation: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_FLUSH_MASK

intrinsic.name: _MM_SET_FLUSH_ZERO_MODE
intrinsic.description: Macro: Set the flush zero bits of the MXCSR control and status register to the value in unsigned 32-bit integer "a". The flush zero may contain any of the following flags: _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_ON or _MM_FLUSH_ZERO_OFF
intrinsic.operation: MXCSR := a[31:0] AND ~_MM_FLUSH_MASK

intrinsic.name: _mm_setcsr
intrinsic.description: Set the MXCSR control and status register with the value in unsigned 32-bit integer "a".
intrinsic.operation: MXCSR := a[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _MM_GET_EXCEPTION_STATE
intrinsic.description: Macro: Get the exception state bits from the MXCSR control and status register. The exception state may contain any of the following flags: _MM_EXCEPT_INVALID, _MM_EXCEPT_DIV_ZERO, _MM_EXCEPT_DENORM, _MM_EXCEPT_OVERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_UNDERFLOW, _MM_EXCEPT_INEXACT
intrinsic.operation: dst[31:0] := MXCSR & _MM_EXCEPT_MASK

intrinsic.name: _mm_getcsr
intrinsic.description: Get the unsigned 32-bit value of the MXCSR control and status register.
intrinsic.operation: dst[31:0] := MXCSR

intrinsic.name: _mm_prefetch
intrinsic.description: Fetch the line of data from memory that contains address "p" to a location in the cache heirarchy specified by the locality hint "i".

intrinsic.name: _mm_sfence
intrinsic.description: Perform a serializing operation on all store-to-memory instructions that were issued prior to this instruction. Guarantees that every store instruction that precedes, in program order, is globally visible before any store instruction which follows the fence in program order.

intrinsic.name: _xrstors64
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at "mem_addr". xrstors differs from xrstor in that it can restore state components corresponding to bits set in the IA32_XSS MSR; xrstors cannot restore from an xsave area in which the extended region is in the standard form. State is restored based on bits [62:0] in "rs_mask", "XCR0", and "mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: st_mask := mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87_FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xrstors
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at "mem_addr". xrstors differs from xrstor in that it can restore state components corresponding to bits set in the IA32_XSS MSR; xrstors cannot restore from an xsave area in which the extended region is in the standard form. State is restored based on bits [62:0] in "rs_mask", "XCR0", and "mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: st_mask := mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87_FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsaves64
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr"; xsaves differs from xsave in that it can save state components corresponding to bits set in IA32_XSS MSR and that it may use the modified optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsavec64
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr"; xsavec differs from xsave in that it uses compaction and that it may use init optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsaves
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr"; xsaves differs from xsave in that it can save state components corresponding to bits set in IA32_XSS MSR and that it may use the modified optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsavec
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr"; xsavec differs from xsave in that it uses compaction and that it may use init optimization. State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsetbv
intrinsic.description: Copy 64-bits from "val" to the extended control register (XCR) specified by "a". Currently only XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK XCR is supported.
intrinsic.operation: XCR[a] := val[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _xsaveopt64
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr". State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary. The hardware may optimize the manner in which data is saved. The performance of this instruction will be equal to or better than using the XSAVE64 instruction.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] 2: mem_addr.EXT_SAVE_Area2[YMM] := ProcessorState[YMM] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsaveopt
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr". State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary. The hardware may optimize the manner in which data is saved. The performance of this instruction will be equal to or better than using the XSAVE instruction.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] 2: mem_addr.EXT_SAVE_Area2[YMM] := ProcessorState[YMM] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsave64
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr". State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xsave
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial save of the enabled processor states to memory at "mem_addr". State is saved based on bits [62:0] in "save_mask" and "XCR0". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: mask[62:0] := save_mask[62:0] AND XCR0[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] := ProcessorState[x87_FPU] 1: mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] := ProcessorState[SSE] DEFAULT: mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] := ProcessorState[i] ESAC mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[i] := INIT_FUNCTION[i] FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xrstor64
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at "mem_addr". State is restored based on bits [62:0] in "rs_mask", "XCR0", and "mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: st_mask := mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87_FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _xrstor
intrinsic.description: Perform a full or partial restore of the enabled processor states using the state information stored in memory at "mem_addr". State is restored based on bits [62:0] in "rs_mask", "XCR0", and "mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV". "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 64-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: st_mask := mem_addr.HEADER.XSTATE_BV[62:0] FOR i := 0 to 62 IF (rs_mask[i] AND XCR0[i]) IF st_mask[i] CASE (i) OF 0: ProcessorState[x87_FPU] := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[FPU] 1: ProcessorState[SSE] := mem_addr.FPUSSESaveArea[SSE] DEFAULT: ProcessorState[i] := mem_addr.Ext_Save_Area[i] ESAC ELSE // ProcessorExtendedState := Processor Supplied Values CASE (i) OF 1: MXCSR := mem_addr.FPUSSESave_Area[SSE] ESAC FI FI i := i + 1 ENDFOR

intrinsic.name: _wbnoinvd
intrinsic.description: Write back and do not flush internal caches. Initiate writing-back without flushing of external caches.

intrinsic.name: _xgetbv
intrinsic.description: Copy up to 64-bits from the value of the extended control register (XCR) specified by "a" into "dst". Currently only XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK XCR is supported.
intrinsic.operation: dst[63:0] := XCR[a]

intrinsic.name: _tpause
intrinsic.description: Directs the processor to enter an implementation-dependent optimized state until the TSC reaches or exceeds the value specified in "counter". Bit 0 of "ctrl" selects between a lower power (cleared) or faster wakeup (set) optimized state. Returns the carry flag (CF).

intrinsic.name: _umwait
intrinsic.description: Directs the processor to enter an implementation-dependent optimized state while monitoring a range of addresses. The instruction wakes up when the TSC reaches or exceeds the value specified in "counter" (if the monitoring hardware did not trigger beforehand). Bit 0 of "ctrl" selects between a lower power (cleared) or faster wakeup (set) optimized state. Returns the carry flag (CF).

intrinsic.name: _umonitor
intrinsic.description: Sets up a linear address range to be monitored by hardware and activates the monitor. The address range should be a writeback memory caching type. The address is contained in "a".

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_epi8
intrinsic.description: Set packed 8-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_epi16
intrinsic.description: Set packed 16-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_epi32
intrinsic.description: Set packed 32-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_epi64
intrinsic.description: Set packed 64-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_epi8
intrinsic.description: Set packed 8-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_epi32
intrinsic.description: Set packed 32-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_epi16
intrinsic.description: Set packed 16-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_epi64
intrinsic.description: Set packed 64-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_epi64x
intrinsic.description: Set packed 64-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_lfence
intrinsic.description: Perform a serializing operation on all load-from-memory instructions that were issued prior to this instruction. Guarantees that every load instruction that precedes, in program order, is globally visible before any load instruction which follows the fence in program order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_mfence
intrinsic.description: Perform a serializing operation on all load-from-memory and store-to-memory instructions that were issued prior to this instruction. Guarantees that every memory access that precedes, in program order, the memory fence instruction is globally visible before any memory instruction which follows the fence in program order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_pause
intrinsic.description: Provide a hint to the processor that the code sequence is a spin-wait loop. This can help improve the performance and power consumption of spin-wait loops.

intrinsic.name: _mm_clflush
intrinsic.description: Invalidate and flush the cache line that contains "p" from all levels of the cache hierarchy.

intrinsic.name: _mm_malloc
intrinsic.description: Allocate "size" bytes of memory, aligned to the alignment specified in "align", and return a pointer to the allocated memory. "_mm_free" should be used to free memory that is allocated with "_mm_malloc".

intrinsic.name: _mm_free
intrinsic.description: Free aligned memory that was allocated with "_mm_malloc".

intrinsic.name: _xtest
intrinsic.description: Query the transactional execution status, return 1 if inside a transactionally executing RTM or HLE region, and return 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF (RTM_ACTIVE == 1 OR HLE_ACTIVE == 1) dst := 1 ELSE dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _serialize
intrinsic.description: Serialize instruction execution, ensuring all modifications to flags, registers, and memory by previous instructions are completed before the next instruction is fetched.

intrinsic.name: _xend
intrinsic.description: Specify the end of an RTM code region. If this corresponds to the outermost scope, the logical processor will attempt to commit the logical processor state atomically. If the commit fails, the logical processor will perform an RTM abort.
intrinsic.operation: IF RTM_ACTIVE == 1 RTM_NEST_COUNT := RTM_NEST_COUNT - 1 IF RTM_NEST_COUNT == 0 // try to commit transaction IF FAIL_TO_COMMIT_TRANSACTION // RTM abort (see _xabort) ELSE RTM_ACTIVE := 0 FI FI FI

intrinsic.name: _xbegin
intrinsic.description: Specify the start of an RTM code region. If the logical processor was not already in transactional execution, then this call causes the logical processor to transition into transactional execution. On an RTM abort, the logical processor discards all architectural register and memory updates performed during the RTM execution, restores architectural state, and starts execution beginning at the fallback address computed from the outermost XBEGIN instruction. Return status of ~0 (0xFFFF) if continuing inside transaction; all other codes are aborts.
intrinsic.operation:
IF RTM_NEST_COUNT < MAX_RTM_NEST_COUNT RTM_NEST_COUNT := RTM_NEST_COUNT + 1 IF RTM_NEST_COUNT == 1 IF _64_BIT_MODE fallbackRIP := RIP ELSE IF _32_BIT_MODE fallbackEIP := EIP FI
RTM_ACTIVE := 1 // enter RTM execution, record register state, start tracking memory state FI ELSE // RTM abort (see _xabort) FI

intrinsic.name: __rdtscp
intrinsic.description: Copy the current 64-bit value of the processor's time-stamp counter into "dst", and store the IA32_TSC_AUX MSR (signature value) into memory at "mem_addr".
intrinsic.operation: dst[63:0] := TimeStampCounter MEM[mem_addr+31:mem_addr] := IA32_TSC_AUX[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _xabort
intrinsic.description: Force an RTM abort. The EAX register is updated to reflect an XABORT instruction caused the abort, and the "imm8" parameter will be provided in bits [31:24] of EAX. Following an RTM abort, the logical processor resumes execution at the fallback address computed through the outermost XBEGIN instruction.
intrinsic.operation: IF RTM_ACTIVE == 0 // nop ELSE // restore architectural register state // discard memory updates performed in transaction // update EAX with status and imm8 value eax[31:24] := imm8[7:0] RTM_NEST_COUNT := 0 RTM_ACTIVE := 0 IF _64_BIT_MODE RIP := fallbackRIP ELSE EIP := fallbackEIP FI FI

intrinsic.name: _rdseed32_step
intrinsic.description: Read a 32-bit NIST SP800-90B and SP800-90C compliant random value and store in "val". Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF HW_NRND_GEN.ready == 1 val[31:0] := HW_NRND_GEN.data dst := 1 ELSE val[31:0] := 0 dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _rdseed64_step
intrinsic.description: Read a 64-bit NIST SP800-90B and SP800-90C compliant random value and store in "val". Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF HW_NRND_GEN.ready == 1 val[63:0] := HW_NRND_GEN.data dst := 1 ELSE val[63:0] := 0 dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _rdrand64_step
intrinsic.description: Read a hardware generated 64-bit random value and store the result in "val". Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF HW_RND_GEN.ready == 1 val[63:0] := HW_RND_GEN.data dst := 1 ELSE val[63:0] := 0 dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _rdseed16_step
intrinsic.description: Read a 16-bit NIST SP800-90B and SP800-90C compliant random value and store in "val". Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF HW_NRND_GEN.ready == 1 val[15:0] := HW_NRND_GEN.data dst := 1 ELSE val[15:0] := 0 dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _rdrand16_step
intrinsic.description: Read a hardware generated 16-bit random value and store the result in "val". Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF HW_RND_GEN.ready == 1 val[15:0] := HW_RND_GEN.data dst := 1 ELSE val[15:0] := 0 dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _rdrand32_step
intrinsic.description: Read a hardware generated 32-bit random value and store the result in "val". Return 1 if a random value was generated, and 0 otherwise.
intrinsic.operation: IF HW_RND_GEN.ready == 1 val[31:0] := HW_RND_GEN.data dst := 1 ELSE val[31:0] := 0 dst := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _mm_prefetch
intrinsic.description: Fetch the line of data from memory that contains address "p" to a location in the cache heirarchy specified by the locality hint "i".

intrinsic.name: _rdpid_u32
intrinsic.description: Copy the IA32_TSC_AUX MSR (signature value) into "dst".

intrinsic.name: _pconfig_u32
intrinsic.description: Invoke the PCONFIG leaf function specified by "a". The "__data" array contains 3 32-bit elements that may act as input, output, or be unused, depending on the semantics of the specified leaf function; these correspond to rbx, rcx, and rdx. May return the value in eax, depending on the semantics of the specified leaf function.

intrinsic.name: _enclv_u32
intrinsic.description: Invoke the Intel SGX enclave virtualized (VMM) leaf function specified by "a", and return the error code. The "__data" array contains 3 32-bit elements that may act as input, output, or be unused, depending on the semantics of the specified leaf function; these correspond to ebx, ecx, and edx.

intrinsic.name: _wbinvd
intrinsic.description: Write back and flush internal caches. Initiate writing-back and flushing of external caches.

intrinsic.name: _ptwrite32
intrinsic.description: Insert the 32-bit data from "a" into a Processor Trace stream via a PTW packet. The PTW packet will be inserted if tracing is currently enabled and ptwrite is currently enabled. The current IP will also be inserted via a FUP packet if FUPonPTW is enabled.

intrinsic.name: _ptwrite64
intrinsic.description: Insert the 64-bit data from "a" into a Processor Trace stream via a PTW packet. The PTW packet will be inserted if tracing is currently enabled and ptwrite is currently enabled. The current IP will also be inserted via a FUP packet if FUPonPTW is enabled.

intrinsic.name: _enclu_u32
intrinsic.description: Invoke the Intel SGX enclave user (non-privilege) leaf function specified by "a", and return the error code. The "__data" array contains 3 32-bit elements that may act as input, output, or be unused, depending on the semantics of the specified leaf function; these correspond to ebx, ecx, and edx.

intrinsic.name: _encls_u32
intrinsic.description: Invoke the Intel SGX enclave system (privileged) leaf function specified by "a", and return the error code. The "__data" array contains 3 32-bit elements that may act as input, output, or be unused, depending on the semantics of the specified leaf function; these correspond to ebx, ecx, and edx.

intrinsic.name: _rdpmc
intrinsic.description: Read the Performance Monitor Counter (PMC) specified by "a", and store up to 64-bits in "dst". The width of performance counters is implementation specific.
intrinsic.operation: dst[63:0] := ReadPMC(a)

intrinsic.name: _may_i_use_cpu_feature
intrinsic.description: Dynamically query the processor to determine if the processor-specific feature(s) specified in "a" are available, and return true or false (1 or 0) if the set of features is available. Multiple features may be OR'd together. This intrinsic does not check the processor vendor. See the valid feature flags below:
intrinsic.operation: _FEATURE_GENERIC_IA32 _FEATURE_FPU _FEATURE_CMOV _FEATURE_MMX _FEATURE_FXSAVE _FEATURE_SSE _FEATURE_SSE2 _FEATURE_SSE3 _FEATURE_SSSE3 _FEATURE_SSE4_1 _FEATURE_SSE4_2 _FEATURE_MOVBE _FEATURE_POPCNT _FEATURE_PCLMULQDQ _FEATURE_AES _FEATURE_F16C _FEATURE_AVX _FEATURE_RDRND _FEATURE_FMA _FEATURE_BMI _FEATURE_LZCNT _FEATURE_HLE _FEATURE_RTM _FEATURE_AVX2 _FEATURE_KNCNI _FEATURE_AVX512F _FEATURE_ADX _FEATURE_RDSEED _FEATURE_AVX512ER _FEATURE_AVX512PF _FEATURE_AVX512CD _FEATURE_SHA _FEATURE_MPX _FEATURE_AVX512BW _FEATURE_AVX512VL _FEATURE_AVX512VBMI _FEATURE_AVX512_4FMAPS _FEATURE_AVX512_4VNNIW _FEATURE_AVX512_VPOPCNTDQ _FEATURE_AVX512_BITALG _FEATURE_AVX512_VBMI2 _FEATURE_GFNI _FEATURE_VAES _FEATURE_VPCLMULQDQ _FEATURE_AVX512_VNNI _FEATURE_CLWB _FEATURE_RDPID _FEATURE_IBT _FEATURE_SHSTK _FEATURE_SGX _FEATURE_WBNOINVD _FEATURE_PCONFIG _FEATURE_AXV512_4VNNIB _FEATURE_AXV512_4FMAPH _FEATURE_AXV512_BITALG2 _FEATURE_AXV512_VP2INTERSECT

intrinsic.name: _allow_cpu_features
intrinsic.description: Treat the processor-specific feature(s) specified in "a" as available. Multiple features may be OR'd together. See the valid feature flags below:
intrinsic.operation: _FEATURE_GENERIC_IA32 _FEATURE_FPU _FEATURE_CMOV _FEATURE_MMX _FEATURE_FXSAVE _FEATURE_SSE _FEATURE_SSE2 _FEATURE_SSE3 _FEATURE_SSSE3 _FEATURE_SSE4_1 _FEATURE_SSE4_2 _FEATURE_MOVBE _FEATURE_POPCNT _FEATURE_PCLMULQDQ _FEATURE_AES _FEATURE_F16C _FEATURE_AVX _FEATURE_RDRND _FEATURE_FMA _FEATURE_BMI _FEATURE_LZCNT _FEATURE_HLE _FEATURE_RTM _FEATURE_AVX2 _FEATURE_KNCNI _FEATURE_AVX512F _FEATURE_ADX _FEATURE_RDSEED _FEATURE_AVX512ER _FEATURE_AVX512PF _FEATURE_AVX512CD _FEATURE_SHA _FEATURE_MPX _FEATURE_AVX512BW _FEATURE_AVX512VL _FEATURE_AVX512VBMI _FEATURE_AVX512_4FMAPS _FEATURE_AVX512_4VNNIW _FEATURE_AVX512_VPOPCNTDQ _FEATURE_AVX512_BITALG _FEATURE_AVX512_VBMI2 _FEATURE_GFNI _FEATURE_VAES _FEATURE_VPCLMULQDQ _FEATURE_AVX512_VNNI _FEATURE_CLWB _FEATURE_RDPID _FEATURE_IBT _FEATURE_SHSTK _FEATURE_SGX _FEATURE_WBNOINVD _FEATURE_PCONFIG _FEATURE_AXV512_4VNNIB _FEATURE_AXV512_4FMAPH _FEATURE_AXV512_BITALG2 _FEATURE_AXV512_VP2INTERSECT

intrinsic.name: _bnd_get_ptr_lbound
intrinsic.description: Return the lower bound of "q".
intrinsic.operation: dst := q.LB

intrinsic.name: _bnd_get_ptr_ubound
intrinsic.description: Return the upper bound of "q".
intrinsic.operation: dst := q.UB

intrinsic.name: _bnd_chk_ptr_ubounds
intrinsic.description: Checks if "q" is within its upper bound, and throws a #BR if not.
intrinsic.operation: IF q > q.UB #BR FI

intrinsic.name: _bnd_chk_ptr_bounds
intrinsic.description: Checks if ["q", "q" + "size" - 1] is within the lower and upper bounds of "q" and throws a #BR if not.
intrinsic.operation: IF (q + size - 1) < q.LB OR (q + size - 1) > q.UB #BR FI

intrinsic.name: _bnd_store_ptr_bounds
intrinsic.description: Stores the bounds of "ptr_val" pointer in memory at address "ptr_addr".
intrinsic.operation: MEM[ptr_addr].LB := ptr_val.LB MEM[ptr_addr].UB := ptr_val.UB

intrinsic.name: _bnd_chk_ptr_lbounds
intrinsic.description: Checks if "q" is within its lower bound, and throws a #BR if not.
intrinsic.operation: IF q < q.LB #BR FI

intrinsic.name: _bnd_copy_ptr_bounds
intrinsic.description: Make a pointer with the value of "q" and bounds set to the bounds of "r" (e.g. copy the bounds of "r" to pointer "q"), and store the result in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst := q dst.LB := r.LB dst.UB := r.UB

intrinsic.name: _bnd_init_ptr_bounds
intrinsic.description: Make a pointer with the value of "q" and open bounds, which allow the pointer to access the entire virtual address space, and store the result in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst := q dst.LB := 0 dst.UB := 0

intrinsic.name: _bnd_narrow_ptr_bounds
intrinsic.description: Narrow the bounds for pointer "q" to the intersection of the bounds of "r" and the bounds ["q", "q" + "size" - 1], and store the result in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst := q IF r.LB > (q + size - 1) OR r.UB < q dst.LB := 1 dst.UB := 0 ELSE dst.LB := MAX(r.LB, q) dst.UB := MIN(r.UB, (q + size - 1)) FI

intrinsic.name: _mm_monitor
intrinsic.description: Arm address monitoring hardware using the address specified in "p". A store to an address within the specified address range triggers the monitoring hardware. Specify optional extensions in "extensions", and optional hints in "hints".

intrinsic.name: _mm_mwait
intrinsic.description: Hint to the processor that it can enter an implementation-dependent-optimized state while waiting for an event or store operation to the address range specified by MONITOR.

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_pi8
intrinsic.description: Set packed 8-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_pi32
intrinsic.description: Set packed 32-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_setr_pi16
intrinsic.description: Set packed 16-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values in reverse order.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_pi8
intrinsic.description: Set packed 8-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_pi32
intrinsic.description: Set packed 32-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_set_pi16
intrinsic.description: Set packed 16-bit integers in "dst" with the supplied values.

intrinsic.name: _mm_empty
intrinsic.description: Empty the MMX state, which marks the x87 FPU registers as available for use by x87 instructions. This instruction must be used at the end of all MMX technology procedures.

intrinsic.name: _m_empty
intrinsic.description: Empty the MMX state, which marks the x87 FPU registers as available for use by x87 instructions. This instruction must be used at the end of all MMX technology procedures.

intrinsic.name: _mm_spflt_64
intrinsic.description: Set performance monitoring filtering mask to 64-bit unsigned integer "r1".
intrinsic.operation: SetPerfMonMask(r1[63:0])

intrinsic.name: _mm_clevict
intrinsic.description: Evicts the cache line containing the address "ptr" from cache level "level" (can be either 0 or 1).
intrinsic.operation: CacheLineEvict(ptr, level)

intrinsic.name: _mm_delay_32
intrinsic.description: Stalls a thread without blocking other threads for 32-bit unsigned integer "r1" clock cycles.
intrinsic.operation: BlockThread(r1)

intrinsic.name: _mm_delay_64
intrinsic.description: Stalls a thread without blocking other threads for 64-bit unsigned integer "r1" clock cycles.
intrinsic.operation: BlockThread(r1)

intrinsic.name: _mm_spflt_32
intrinsic.description: Set performance monitoring filtering mask to 32-bit unsigned integer "r1".
intrinsic.operation: SetPerfMonMask(r1[31:0])

intrinsic.name: _mm_countbits_32
intrinsic.description: Counts the number of set bits in 32-bit unsigned integer "r1", returning the results in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst[31:0] := PopCount(r1[31:0])

intrinsic.name: _mm_countbits_64
intrinsic.description: Counts the number of set bits in 64-bit unsigned integer "r1", returning the results in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst[63:0] := PopCount(r1[63:0])

intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extpackstorelo_epi64
intrinsic.description: Down-converts and stores packed 64-bit integer elements of "v1" into a quadword stream according to "conv" at a logically mapped starting address "mt", storing the low-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map before the first 64-byte-aligned address follwing "mt"). "hint" indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal. Elements are stored to memory according to element selector "k" (elements are skipped whent he corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE DOWNCONVERT(element, convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN element[63:0] ESAC } DEFINE DOWNCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } storeOffset := 0 downSize := DOWNCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt FOR j := 0 to 7 IF k[j] i := j*63 tmp := DOWNCONVERT(v1[i+63:i], conv) storeAddr := addr + storeOffset * downSize CASE downSize OF 8: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[63:0] ESAC storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 IF ((addr + storeOffset * downSize) % 64) == 0 BREAK FI FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_extpackstorelo_epi64
intrinsic.description: Down-converts and stores packed 64-bit integer elements of "v1" into a quadword stream according to "conv" at a logically mapped starting address "mt", storing the low-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map before the first 64-byte-aligned address follwing "mt"). "hint" indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE DOWNCONVERT(element, convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN element[63:0] ESAC } DEFINE DOWNCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } storeOffset := 0 downSize := DOWNCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*63 tmp := DOWNCONVERT(v1[i+63:i], conv) storeAddr := addr + storeOffset * downSize CASE downSize OF 8: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[63:0] ESAC storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 IF ((addr + storeOffset * downSize) % 64) == 0 BREAK FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extpackstorehi_epi64

"hint" indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal. Elements are stored to memory according to element selector "k" (elements are skipped when the corresonding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE DOWNCONVERT(element, convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN element[63:0] ESAC } DEFINE DOWNCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false downSize := DOWNCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 7 IF k[j] IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*downSize) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := true FI ELSE i := j*64 tmp := DOWNCONVERT(v1[i+63:i], conv) storeAddr := addr + storeOffset * downSize CASE downSize OF 8: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[63:0] ESAC FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_extpackstorehi_epi64
intrinsic.description: Down-converts and stores packed 64-bit integer elements of "v1" into a quadword stream according to "conv" at a logically mapped starting address (mt-64), storing the high-64-byte elements of that stream (those elemetns of the stream that map at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (m5-64)). "hint" indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE DOWNCONVERT(element, convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN element[63:0] ESAC } DEFINE DOWNCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false downSize := DOWNCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 7 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*downSize) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := true FI ELSE i := j*64 tmp := DOWNCONVERT(v1[i+63:i], conv) storeAddr := addr + storeOffset * downSize CASE downSize OF 8: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[63:0] ESAC FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extpackstorelo_epi32
intrinsic.description: Down-converts and stores packed 32-bit integer elements of "v1" into a byte/word/doubleword stream according to "conv" at a logically mapped starting address "mt", storing the low-64-byte elements of that stream (those elements of the stream that map before the first 64-byte-aligned address follwing "mt"). "hint" indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal. Elements are written to memory according to element selector "k" (elements are skipped when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE DOWNCONVERT(element, convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN element[31:0] _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN Truncate8(element[31:0]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN Saturate8(element[31:0]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN Truncate16(element[31:0]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN Saturate16(element[31:0]) ESAC } DEFINE DOWNCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN 4 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN 2 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN 2 ESAC } storeOffset := 0 downSize := DOWNCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt FOR j := 0 to 15 IF k[j] i := j*32 tmp := DOWNCONVERT(v1[i+31:i], conv) storeAddr := addr + storeOffset * downSize CASE downSize OF 4: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[31:0] 2: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[15:0] 1: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[7:0] ESAC storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 IF ((addr + storeOffset * downSize) % 64) == 0 BREAK FI FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

"hint" indicates to the processor whether the data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE DOWNCONVERT(element, convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN element[31:0] _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN Truncate8(element[31:0]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN Saturate8(element[31:0]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN Truncate16(element[31:0]) _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN Saturate16(element[31:0]) ESAC } DEFINE DOWNCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE convertTo OF _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN 4 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN 2 _MM_DOWNCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN 2 ESAC } storeOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false downSize := DOWNCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 15 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF ((addr + (storeOffset + 1)*downSize) % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := true FI ELSE i := j*32 tmp := DOWNCONVERT(v1[i+31:i], conv) storeAddr := addr + storeOffset * downSize CASE downSize OF 4: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[31:0] 2: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[15:0] 1: MEM[storeAddr] := tmp[7:0] ESAC FI storeOffset := storeOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extloadunpacklo_epi64
intrinsic.description: Loads the low-64-byte-aligned portion of the quadword stream starting at element-aligned address mt, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 64-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted quadwords that occur before first 64-byte-aligned address following "mt" are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal. Elements are copied to "dst" according to element selector "k" (elements are skipped when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE UPCONVERT(addr, offset, convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN MEM[addr + 8*offset] ESAC } DEFINE UPCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } dst[511:0] := src[511:0] loadOffset := 0 upSize := UPCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt FOR j := 0 to 7 IF k[j] i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := UPCONVERT(addr, loadOffset, conv) loadOffset := loadOffset + 1 IF (addr + loadOffset*upSize % 64) == 0 BREAK FI FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_extloadunpacklo_epi64
intrinsic.description: Loads the low-64-byte-aligned portion of the quadword stream starting at element-aligned address mt, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 64-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted quad that occur before first 64-byte-aligned address following "mt" are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE UPCONVERT(addr, offset, convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN MEM[addr + 8*offset] ESAC } DEFINE UPCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } dst[511:0] := src[511:0] loadOffset := 0 upSize := UPCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt FOR j := 0 to 7 i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := UPCONVERT(addr, loadOffset, conv) loadOffset := loadOffset + 1 IF (addr + loadOffset*upSize % 64) == 0 BREAK FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extloadunpackhi_epi64
intrinsic.description: Loads the high-64-byte-aligned portion of the quadword stream starting at element-aligned address mt-64, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 64-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted quadwords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those quadwords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal. Elements are copied to "dst" according to element selector "k" (elements are skipped when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE UPCONVERT(addr, offset, convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN MEM[addr + 8*offset] ESAC } DEFINE UPCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI64_NONE: RETURN 8 ESAC } dst[511:0] := src[511:0] loadOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false upSize := UPCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 7 IF k[j] IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF (addr + (loadOffset + 1)*upSize) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := true FI ELSE i := j*64 dst[i+63:i] := UPCONVERT(addr, loadOffset, conv) FI loadOffset := loadOffset + 1 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.description: Loads the high-64-byte-aligned portion of the quadword stream starting at element-aligned address mt-64, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 64-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted quadwords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extloadunpacklo_epi32
intrinsic.description: Loads the low-64-byte-aligned portion of the byte/word/doubleword stream starting at element-aligned address mt, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 32-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted doublewords that occur before first 64-byte-aligned address following "mt" are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal. The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted doublewords that occur before first 64-byte-aligned address following "mt" are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE UPCONVERT(addr, offset, convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN MEM[addr + 4*offset] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN ZeroExtend32(MEM[addr + offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN SignExtend32(MEM[addr + offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN ZeroExtend32(MEM[addr + 2*offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN SignExtend32(MEM[addr + 2*offset]) ESAC } DEFINE UPCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN 4 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN 2 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN 2 ESAC } dst[511:0] := src[511:0] loadOffset := 0 upSize := UPCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt FOR j := 0 to 15 i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := UPCONVERT(addr, loadOffset, conv) loadOffset := loadOffset + 1 IF (mt + loadOffset * upSize) % 64 == 0 BREAK FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_mask_extloadunpackhi_epi32
intrinsic.description: Loads the high-64-byte-aligned portion of the byte/word/doubleword stream starting at element-aligned address mt-64, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 32-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted doublewords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal. Elements are copied to "dst" according to element selector "k" (elements are skipped when the corresponding mask bit is not set).
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE UPCONVERT(addr, offset, convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN MEM[addr + 4*offset] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN ZeroExtend32(MEM[addr + offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN SignExtend32(MEM[addr + offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN ZeroExtend32(MEM[addr + 2*offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN SignExtend32(MEM[addr + 2*offset]) ESAC } DEFINE UPCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN 4 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN 2 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN 2 ESAC } dst[511:0] := src[511:0] loadOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false upSize := UPCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 15 IF k[j] IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF (addr + (loadOffset + 1)*upSize % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := true FI ELSE i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := UPCONVERT(addr, loadOffset, conv) FI loadOffset := loadOffset + 1 FI ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_extloadunpackhi_epi32
intrinsic.description: Loads the high-64-byte-aligned portion of the byte/word/doubleword stream starting at element-aligned address mt-64, up-converted depending on the value of "conv", and expanded into packed 32-bit integers in "dst". The initial values of "dst" are copied from "src". Only those converted doublewords that occur at or after the first 64-byte-aligned address following (mt-64) are loaded. Elements in the resulting vector that do not map to those doublewords are taken from "src". "hint" indicates to the processor whether the loaded data is non-temporal.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE UPCONVERT(addr, offset, convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN MEM[addr + 4*offset] _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN ZeroExtend32(MEM[addr + offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN SignExtend32(MEM[addr + offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN ZeroExtend32(MEM[addr + 2*offset]) _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN SignExtend32(MEM[addr + 2*offset]) ESAC } DEFINE UPCONVERTSIZE(convertTo) { CASE conv OF _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_NONE: RETURN 4 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT8: RETURN 1 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_UINT16: RETURN 2 _MM_UPCONV_EPI32_SINT16: RETURN 2 ESAC } dst[511:0] := src[511:0] loadOffset := 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := false upSize := UPCONVERTSIZE(conv) addr := mt-64 FOR j := 0 to 15 IF foundNext64BytesBoundary == false IF (addr + (loadOffset + 1)*upSize % 64) == 0 foundNext64BytesBoundary := true FI ELSE i := j*32 dst[i+31:i] := UPCONVERT(addr, loadOffset, conv) FI loadOffset := loadOffset + 1 ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm_prefetch
intrinsic.description: Fetch the line of data from memory that contains address "p" to a location in the cache heirarchy specified by the locality hint "i".

intrinsic.name: _invpcid
intrinsic.description: Invalidate mappings in the Translation Lookaside Buffers (TLBs) and paging-structure caches for the processor context identifier (PCID) specified by "descriptor" based on the invalidation type specified in "type". The PCID "descriptor" is specified as a 16-byte memory operand (with no alignment restrictions) where bits [11:0] specify the PCID, and bits [127:64] specify the linear address; bits [63:12] are reserved. The types supported are: 0) Individual-address invalidation: If "type" is 0, the logical processor invalidates mappings for a single linear address and tagged with the PCID specified in "descriptor", except global translations. The instruction may also invalidate global translations, mappings for other linear addresses, or mappings tagged with other PCIDs. 1) Single-context invalidation: If "type" is 1, the logical processor invalidates all mappings tagged with the PCID specified in "descriptor" except global translations. In some cases, it may invalidate mappings for other PCIDs as well. 2) All-context invalidation: If "type" is 2, the logical processor invalidates all mappings tagged with any PCID. 3) All-context invalidation, retaining global translations: If "type" is 3, the logical processor invalidates all mappings tagged with any PCID except global translations, ignoring "descriptor". The instruction may also invalidate global translations as well.
intrinsic.operation: CASE type[1:0] OF 0: // individual-address invalidation retaining global translations OP_PCID := MEM[descriptor+11:descriptor] ADDR := MEM[descriptor+127:descriptor+64] BREAK 1: // single PCID invalidation retaining globals OP_PCID := MEM[descriptor+11:descriptor] // invalidate all mappings tagged with OP_PCID except global translations BREAK 2: // all PCID invalidation // invalidate all mappings tagged with any PCID BREAK 3: // all PCID invalidation retaining global translations // invalidate all mappings tagged with any PCID except global translations BREAK ESAC

intrinsic.name: _fxsave
intrinsic.description: Save the current state of the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers to a 512-byte memory location at "mem_addr". The layout of the 512-byte region depends on the operating mode. Bytes [511:464] are available for software use and will not be overwritten by the processor.
intrinsic.operation: MEM[mem_addr+512*8:mem_addr] := fxsave(state_x87_fpu_mmx_sse)

intrinsic.name: _fxsave64
intrinsic.description: Save the current state of the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers to a 512-byte memory location at "mem_addr". The layout of the 512-byte region depends on the operating mode. Bytes [511:464] are available for software use and will not be overwritten by the processor.
intrinsic.operation: MEM[mem_addr+512*8:mem_addr] := fxsave64(state_x87_fpu_mmx_sse)

intrinsic.name: _writegsbase_u64
intrinsic.description: Write the unsigned 64-bit integer "a" to the GS segment base register.
intrinsic.operation: GS_Segment_Base_Register[63:0] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _fxrstor
intrinsic.description: Reload the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers from the 512-byte memory image at "mem_addr". This data should have been written to memory previously using the FXSAVE instruction, and in the same format as required by the operating mode. "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: state_x87_fpu_mmx_sse := fxrstor(MEM[mem_addr+512*8:mem_addr])

intrinsic.name: _fxrstor64
intrinsic.description: Reload the x87 FPU, MMX technology, XMM, and MXCSR registers from the 512-byte memory image at "mem_addr". This data should have been written to memory previously using the FXSAVE64 instruction, and in the same format as required by the operating mode. "mem_addr" must be aligned on a 16-byte boundary.
intrinsic.operation: state_x87_fpu_mmx_sse := fxrstor64(MEM[mem_addr+512*8:mem_addr])

intrinsic.name: _writefsbase_u64
intrinsic.description: Write the unsigned 64-bit integer "a" to the FS segment base register.
intrinsic.operation: FS_Segment_Base_Register[63:0] := a[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _writegsbase_u32

intrinsic.name: _writefsbase_u32
intrinsic.description: Write the unsigned 32-bit integer "a" to the FS segment base register.
intrinsic.operation: FS_Segment_Base_Register[31:0] := a[31:0] FS_Segment_Base_Register[63:32] := 0

intrinsic.name: _readgsbase_u32
intrinsic.description: Read the GS segment base register and store the 32-bit result in "dst".

intrinsic.name: _mm256_zeroupper
intrinsic.description: Zero the upper 128 bits of all YMM registers; the lower 128-bits of the registers are unmodified.

intrinsic.name: _mm256_zeroall
intrinsic.description: Zero the contents of all XMM or YMM registers.
intrinsic.operation: YMM0[MAX:0] := 0 YMM1[MAX:0] := 0 YMM2[MAX:0] := 0 YMM3[MAX:0] := 0 YMM4[MAX:0] := 0 YMM5[MAX:0] := 0 YMM6[MAX:0] := 0 YMM7[MAX:0] := 0 IF _64_BIT_MODE YMM8[MAX:0] := 0 YMM9[MAX:0] := 0 YMM10[MAX:0] := 0 YMM11[MAX:0] := 0 YMM12[MAX:0] := 0 YMM13[MAX:0] := 0 YMM14[MAX:0] := 0 YMM15[MAX:0] := 0 FI

intrinsic.name: _mm_undefined_si128
intrinsic.description: Return vector of type __m128i with undefined elements.

intrinsic.name: _mm_clwb
intrinsic.description: Write back to memory the cache line that contains "p" from any level of the cache hierarchy in the cache coherence domain.

intrinsic.name: _readfsbase_u32
intrinsic.description: Read the FS segment base register and store the 32-bit result in "dst".

intrinsic.operation: dst[63:0] := FS_Segment_Base_Register

intrinsic.name: _get_ssp
intrinsic.description: If CET is enabled, read the current shadow stack pointer, and store the result in "dst". Otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.operation: dst := SSP[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _inc_ssp
intrinsic.description: Increment the shadow stack pointer by 4 times the value specified in bits [7:0] of "a".
intrinsic.operation: SSP := SSP + a[7:0] * 4

intrinsic.name: _mm_cldemote
intrinsic.description: Hint to hardware that the cache line that contains "p" should be demoted from the cache closest to the processor core to a level more distant from the processor core.

intrinsic.name: _mm_clflushopt
intrinsic.description: Invalidate and flush the cache line that contains "p" from all levels of the cache hierarchy.

intrinsic.name: _wrussq
intrinsic.description: Write 64-bit value in "val" to a user shadow stack page in memory specified by "p".

intrinsic.name: _setssbsy
intrinsic.description: Mark shadow stack pointed to by IA32_PL0_SSP as busy.

intrinsic.name: _clrssbsy
intrinsic.description: Mark shadow stack pointed to by "p" as not busy.

intrinsic.name: _get_ssp
intrinsic.description: If CET is enabled, read the low 32-bits of the current shadow stack pointer, and store the result in "dst". Otherwise return 0.
intrinsic.operation: dst := SSP[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _rstorssp
intrinsic.description: Restore the saved shadow stack pointer from the shadow stack restore token previously created on shadow stack by saveprevssp.

intrinsic.name: _wrssd
intrinsic.description: Write 32-bit value in "val" to a shadow stack page in memory specified by "p".

intrinsic.name: _wrssq
intrinsic.description: Write 64-bit value in "val" to a shadow stack page in memory specified by "p".

intrinsic.name: _wrussd
intrinsic.description: Write 32-bit value in "val" to a user shadow stack page in memory specified by "p".

intrinsic.name: _incsspq
intrinsic.description: Increment the shadow stack pointer by 8 times the value specified in bits [7:0] of "a".
intrinsic.operation: SSP := SSP + a[7:0] * 8

intrinsic.name: _rdsspd_i32
intrinsic.description: Read the low 32-bits of the current shadow stack pointer, and store the result in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst := SSP[31:0]

intrinsic.name: _rdsspq_i64
intrinsic.description: Read the current shadow stack pointer, and store the result in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst := SSP[63:0]

intrinsic.name: _saveprevssp
intrinsic.description: Save the previous shadow stack pointer context.

intrinsic.name: _incsspd
intrinsic.description: Increment the shadow stack pointer by 4 times the value specified in bits [7:0] of "a".
intrinsic.operation: SSP := SSP + a[7:0] * 4

intrinsic.name: _MM_TRANSPOSE4_PS
intrinsic.description: Macro: Transpose the 4x4 matrix formed by the 4 rows of single-precision (32-bit) floating-point elements in "row0", "row1", "row2", and "row3", and store the transposed matrix in these vectors ("row0" now contains column 0, etc.).

intrinsic.name: _mm_setzero_si128
intrinsic.description: Return vector of type __m128i with all elements set to zero.
intrinsic.operation: dst[MAX:0] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm512_clmulepi64_epi128
intrinsic.description: Carry-less multiplication of one quadword of 'b' by one quadword of 'c', stores the 128-bit result in 'dst'. The immediate 'Imm8' is used to determine which quadwords of 'b' and 'c' should be used.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE PCLMUL128(X,Y) { FOR i := 0 to 63 TMP[i] := X[ 0 ] and Y[ i ] FOR j := 1 to i TMP[i] := TMP[i] xor (X[ j ] and Y[ i - j ]) ENDFOR DEST[ i ] := TMP[ i ] ENDFOR FOR i := 64 to 126 TMP[i] := 0 FOR j := i - 63 to 63 TMP[i] := TMP[i] xor (X[ j ] and Y[ i - j ]) ENDFOR DEST[ i ] := TMP[ i ] ENDFOR DEST[127] := 0 RETURN DEST // 128b vector } FOR i := 0 to 3 IF Imm8[0] == 0 TEMP1 := b.m128[i].qword[0] ELSE TEMP1 := b.m128[i].qword[1] FI IF Imm8[4] == 0 TEMP2 := c.m128[i].qword[0] ELSE TEMP2 := c.m128[i].qword[1] FI dst.m128[i] := PCLMUL128(TEMP1, TEMP2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:512] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm256_clmulepi64_epi128
intrinsic.description: Carry-less multiplication of one quadword of 'b' by one quadword of 'c', stores the 128-bit result in 'dst'. The immediate 'Imm8' is used to determine which quadwords of 'b' and 'c' should be used.
intrinsic.operation: DEFINE PCLMUL128(X,Y) { FOR i := 0 to 63 TMP[i] := X[ 0 ] and Y[ i ] FOR j := 1 to i TMP[i] := TMP[i] xor (X[ j ] and Y[ i - j ]) ENDFOR DEST[ i ] := TMP[ i ] ENDFOR FOR i := 64 to 126 TMP[i] := 0 FOR j := i - 63 to 63 TMP[i] := TMP[i] xor (X[ j ] and Y[ i - j ]) ENDFOR DEST[ i ] := TMP[ i ] ENDFOR DEST[127] := 0 RETURN DEST // 128b vector } FOR i := 0 to 1 IF Imm8[0] == 0 TEMP1 := b.m128[i].qword[0] ELSE TEMP1 := b.m128[i].qword[1] FI IF Imm8[4] == 0 TEMP2 := c.m128[i].qword[0] ELSE TEMP2 := c.m128[i].qword[1] FI dst.m128[i] := PCLMUL128(TEMP1, TEMP2) ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _rdtsc
intrinsic.description: Copy the current 64-bit value of the processor's time-stamp counter into "dst".
intrinsic.operation: dst[63:0] := TimeStampCounter

intrinsic.name: _xsusldtrk
intrinsic.description: Mark the start of a TSX (HLE/RTM) suspend load address tracking region. If this is used inside a transactional region, subsequent loads are not added to the read set of the transaction. If this is used inside a suspend load address tracking region it will cause transaction abort. If this is used outside of a transactional region it behaves like a NOP.

intrinsic.name: _xresldtrk
intrinsic.description: Mark the end of a TSX (HLE/RTM) suspend load address tracking region. If this is used inside a suspend load address tracking region it will end the suspend region and all following load addresses will be added to the transaction read set. If this is used inside an active transaction but not in a suspend region it will cause transaction abort. If this is used outside of a transactional region it behaves like a NOP.

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpestrc
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings in "a" and "b" with lengths "la" and "lb" using the control in "imm8", and returns 1 if the resulting mask was non-zero, and 0 otherwise. [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpestro
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings in "a" and "b" with lengths "la" and "lb" using the control in "imm8", and returns bit 0 of the resulting bit mask. [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpestra
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings in "a" and "b" with lengths "la" and "lb" using the control in "imm8", and returns 1 if "b" did not contain a null character and the resulting mask was zero, and 0 otherwise. [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpestri
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings in "a" and "b" with lengths "la" and "lb" using the control in "imm8", and store the generated index in "dst". [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpistra
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in "a" and "b" using the control in "imm8", and returns 1 if "b" did not contain a null character and the resulting mask was zero, and 0 otherwise. [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpestrm
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings in "a" and "b" with lengths "la" and "lb" using the control in "imm8", and store the generated mask in "dst". [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpistro
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in "a" and "b" using the control in "imm8", and returns bit 0 of the resulting bit mask. [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpistrc
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in "a" and "b" using the control in "imm8", and returns 1 if the resulting mask was non-zero, and 0 otherwise. [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpistri
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in "a" and "b" using the control in "imm8", and store the generated index in "dst". [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm_cmpistrm
intrinsic.description: Compare packed strings with implicit lengths in "a" and "b" using the control in "imm8", and store the generated mask in "dst". [strcmp_note]

intrinsic.name: _mm256_aesdec_epi128
intrinsic.description: Perform one round of an AES decryption flow on data (state) in "a" using the round key in "RoundKey", and store the results in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*128 a[i+127:i] := InvShiftRows(a[i+127:i]) a[i+127:i] := InvSubBytes(a[i+127:i]) a[i+127:i] := InvMixColumns(a[i+127:i]) dst[i+127:i] := a[i+127:i] XOR RoundKey[i+127:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm256_aesenc_epi128
intrinsic.description: Perform one round of an AES encryption flow on data (state) in "a" using the round key in "RoundKey", and store the results in "dst"."
intrinsic.operation: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*128 a[i+127:i] := ShiftRows(a[i+127:i]) a[i+127:i] := SubBytes(a[i+127:i]) a[i+127:i] := MixColumns(a[i+127:i]) dst[i+127:i] := a[i+127:i] XOR RoundKey[i+127:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0

intrinsic.name: _mm256_aesdeclast_epi128
intrinsic.description: Perform the last round of an AES decryption flow on data (state) in "a" using the round key in "RoundKey", and store the results in "dst".
intrinsic.operation: FOR j := 0 to 1 i := j*128 a[i+127:i] := InvShiftRows(a[i+127:i]) a[i+127:i] := InvSubBytes(a[i+127:i]) dst[i+127:i] := a[i+127:i] XOR RoundKey[i+127:i] ENDFOR dst[MAX:256] := 0
